conclusion: ETC is the abbreviation for Electronic Toll Collection system.
The traffic speed at an ETC lane in Chongqing has increased from 20 km/h to 40 km/h.
A car travels at a constant velocity of v0=30 m/s towards the toll station along a straight line.
If it passes through the ETC lane, it needs to decelerate uniformly to v1=5 m/s exactly d=10 m before the center line of the toll station.
The car passes through the center line at constant velocity, and finally accelerates uniformly back to v0 for normal driving.
The magnitude of the car's acceleration and deceleration is 1 m/s² in both processes, and the length of the car body is neglected.
The image shows a driving direction towards a toll booth centerline with a constant speed zone of d=10 m before the ETC lane.

premise: Initial velocity, v0 = 30 m/s; Final velocity, v1 = 5 m/s; Deceleration, a = -1 m/s²
conclusion: Using the kinematic equation: v1² = v0² + 2ad1

premise: The car travels at v1 = 5 m/s for a distance of d = 10 m.
conclusion: Constant Speed Phase: Distance traveled is 10 m.

premise: Initial velocity, v1 = 5 m/s; Final velocity, v0 = 30 m/s; Acceleration, a = 1 m/s²
conclusion: Using the kinematic equation: v0² = v1² + 2ad2
